Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Imageless Navigation in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing THA; The study was conducted at a single orthopedic center.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to surgery with or without imageless navigation

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates whether imageless navigation reduces psoas impingement compared to standard techniques.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the anterior protrusion of the cup above the acetabular rim, measured postoperatively on 3-D CT by a blinded external institute.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant difference was found between the navigated and control groups in mean distance of the cup below the anterosuperior acetabular rim (3.9 mm vs. 4.4 mm; p = 0.72) or anteroinferior rim (4.7 mm vs. 4.2 mm; p = 0.29).

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under [Trial Registration Number].
